intro: Erigeron tripartitus, commonly known as the three-part fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and prairies. It features pale blue to lavender flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually divided into three parts, giving it its common name. Erigeron tripartitus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
